The 2nd SARA Bootcamp brings together researchers, students, and academics for three days of intensive, practical learning on how to write, format, and publish research using Quarto and R - two of the most powerful open-source tools in modern research communication.

SARA believes research produced by and about marginalized communities must be heard. This bootcamp equips you with the tools to publish that research professionally, reproducibly, and beautifully.

## üî¨ What is Quarto?

[Quarto](https://quarto.org/) is a next-generation open-source scientific publishing system. Write in Markdown, embed R or Python code, and publish as PDF, HTML, Word, or a full website ‚Äî all from one document.

:::

::: {.card}

## üë• Who Should Attend?

Researchers, PhD scholars, postgraduates, faculty, NGO professionals, journalists, and anyone who wants to write and publish evidence-based work. No prior coding experience needed for beginners' track.

:::

::: {.card}

## üèÜ What You Take Home

A published or near-published research piece, a working Quarto + R setup, a certificate of participation from SARA, and a network of fellow researchers committed to inclusive knowledge production.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setting Up Your Research Environment
Install R, RStudio, and Quarto. Understand the workflow from data to document.

### üìù Thesis Writing with Quarto Markdown
Structure research papers, reports, and dissertations using Quarto's powerful markdown syntax.

### üìö Citations & Bibliography
Manage references with Zotero and BibTeX. Auto-generate formatted citations in APA, MLA, or Chicago style.

### üåê Publishing to PDF, HTML & Web
Render your research to multiple formats and publish it as a website, PDF report, or journal submission.

### üîÅ Reproducible Research Practices
Learn version control with Git and GitHub to make your research transparent, reproducible, and collaborative.

### üé® Interactive Slides
Quarto replaces PowerPoint, Beamer (LaTeX), and R Markdown slides all at once - with reproducibility, live code output, and web publishing built in.
